p: The essential oil compositions of C. gileadensis are compiled in Table 1. The essential oils were dominated by monoterpene hydrocarbons, followed by oxygenated monoterpenoids. The major components in C. gileadensis oils were the monoterpenes α-pinene (11.1–18.4%), sabinene (15.8–35.9%), β-pinene (5.8–18.0%), p-cymene (4.8–8.4%), limonene (1.3–6.2%), γ-terpinene (0.7–8.1%), and terpinen-4-ol (5.3–18.5%). Sesquiterpenoid concentrations were very low in these samples, and constituted only 0.8%, 10.6%, and 2.4% in the stem, leaf, and fruit oils, respectively. A representative gas chromatogram is shown in Figure 1.
